verse: स ब्रूयान्नास्य जरयैतज्जीर्यति न वधेनास्य हन्यत एतत्सत्यं ब्रह्मपुरमस्मिकामाः समाहिता एष आत्माऽपहतपाप्मा विजरो विमृत्युर्विशोको विजिघत्सोऽपिपासः सत्यकामः सत्यसंकल्पो यथा ह्येवेह प्रजा अन्वाविशन्ति यथानुशासनं यं यमन्तमभिकामा भवन्ति यं जनपदं यं क्षेत्रभागं तं तमेवोपजीवन्ति॥

terms.ब्रह्मपुरम्: in the city of Brahman (metaphorically, the body)

meaning: Translation:He should speak, "His body decays with old age, but it should not be killed. This is the truth in the city of Brahman (the body). We, the devoted, have this self, which is free from sin, without old age, without death, without grief, without hunger, without thirst, desiring truth, and with truthful resolve. Just as living beings (prajāḥ) in this world enter according to what Yama (the god of death) prescribes, they become desirous of Yama (the god of death) and live in his dominion, just like that portion of land which belongs to Yama (the god of death)."
